translated: Connected Discourses With Sāriputta 27.1
Linked Discourses The Defilements, Etc. The Defilements
The Eye
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Yo, bhikkhave, cakkhusmiṁ chandarāgo, cittasseso upakkileso.🔽Yo sotasmiṁ chandarāgo, cittasseso upakkileso.🔽Yo ghānasmiṁ chandarāgo, cittasseso upakkileso.🔽Yo jivhāya chandarāgo, cittasseso upakkileso.🔽Yo kāyasmiṁ chandarāgo, cittasseso upakkileso.
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave cakkhusmiṃ chanda rāgaḥ upakkileso  yaḥ sotasmim chanda rāgaḥ upakkileso  yaḥ gha anasmim chanda rāgaḥ citta sseso upakkileso  yaḥ jivhāya chanda rāgaḥ upakkileso  yaḥ kāyasmiṃ chanda rāgaḥ upakkileso
translated: “Monks, the will and passion for the eye is a defilement of the mind. 🔽The will and passion for the ear … nose … tongue … body …
The will and passion for the mind is a defilement of the mind.

original: Yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno imesu chasu ṭhānesu cetaso upakkileso pahīno hoti, nekkhammaninnañcassa cittaṁ hoti.
analyzed: yatas kho bhikkhave bhikkhunaḥ imesu chasu ṭhānesu cetasaḥ upakkilesaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti nekkhamma ninnam cassa cittam hoti
translated: When a monk has given up the defilements of the mind regarding these six things, his mind inclines to renunciation.

original: Nekkhammaparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ kammaniyaṁ khāyati, abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyesu dhammesū”ti.
analyzed: nekkhamma paribhāvitam cittam kammaniyam khāyati abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyesu dhammesu
translated: A mind developed in renunciation is workable for the realization of the unlearned things.”
The first
Linked Discourses The Defilements, Etc.
Form
At Sāvatthī.

analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave rūpesu chanda rāgaḥ upakkileso
translated: “The will and passion for form is a defilement of the mind. …
“The desire and lust in regard to sounds …🔽in regard to odours …
in regard to flavours …
in regard to tactile objects …
in regard to thoughts is a defilement of the mind.

original: Yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno imesu chasu ṭhānesu cetaso upakkileso pahīno hoti, nekkhammaninnañcassa cittaṁ hoti.
analyzed: yatas kho bhikkhave bhikkhunaḥ imesu chasu ṭhānesu cetasaḥ upakkilesaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti nekkhamma ninnam cassa cittam hoti
translated: “When a bhikkhu abandons the defilement of the mind in regard to these six bases, his mind tends to seclusion.

original: Nekkhammaparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ kammaniyaṁ khāyati, abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyesu dhammesū”ti.
analyzed: nekkhamma paribhāvitam cittam kammaniyam khāyati abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyesu dhammesu
translated: When the mind is nourished with renunciation, it becomes wieldy in regard to the supermundane states that need to be realized by direct knowledge.”
The second section on seclusion is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kamma, the second section, is finished.

translated: When a monk has given up the mental poison in these six cases, his mind inclines to renunciation.

Arisen from Contact
At Sāvatthī.🔽…

original: “Yo, bhikkhave, cakkhusamphassajāya vedanāya chandarāgo, cittasseso upakkileso.🔽Yo sotasamphassajāya vedanāya …🔽yo ghānasamphassajāya vedanāya …
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave cakkhu samphassa jāya vedanāya chanda rāgaḥ citta ssesaḥ upakkilesaḥ  yaḥ sota samphassa jāya vedanāya  yaḥ ghāna samphassa jāya vedanāya
translated: “The desire and lust for eye-contact-born feeling: this is a defilement of the mind.🔽The desire and lust for ear-contact-born feeling …🔽The desire and lust for nose-contact-born feeling …
The desire and lust for tongue-contact-born feeling …
The desire and lust for body-contact-born feeling …

original: yo manosamphassajāya vedanāya chandarāgo, cittasseso upakkileso.
analyzed: yaḥ manaḥ samphassa jāya vedanāya chanda rāgaḥ citta ssesaḥ upakkileso
translated: The desire and lust for mind-contact-born feeling: this is a defilement of the mind.
When a bhikkhu abandons his defilements …
in things to be directly known … that are to be realized by him.

Linked Discourses The Defilements, Second Series
Intentions
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Yo, bhikkhave, rūpasañcetanāya chandarāgo, cittasseso upakkileso.🔽Yo saddasañcetanāya …
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave rūpa sañcetanāya chanda rāgaḥ citta ssesaḥ upakkileso  yaḥ sat dasat cetanāya
translated: “Monks, any desire, lust, delight, craving, attraction, attachment, and clinging in regard to intentions regarding form is a defilement of the mind.

analyzed: yaḥ gandha sañcetanāya  yaḥ rasa sañcetanāya
translated: Any desire, lust, delight, craving, attraction, attachment, and clinging in regard to intentions regarding sound …🔽intentions regarding smell …🔽intentions regarding taste …
intentions regarding touch …

analyzed: yaḥ dhamma sañcetanāya chanda rāgaḥ citta ssesaḥ upakkileso
translated: intentions regarding thoughts is a defilement of the mind.🔽When a monk …

original: Yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno …pe…🔽abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyesu dhammesū”ti.
analyzed: yatas kho bhikkhave bhikkhuno pe  abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyesu dhammesu uti
translated: directly knows …
The seventh.🔽The Linked Discourses with the Kesi Chapter is finished.🔽The Defilements, Second Series
Craving
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Yo, bhikkhave, rūpataṇhāya chandarāgo, cittasseso upakkileso.🔽Yo saddataṇhāya …
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave rūpa taṇhāya chanda rāgaḥ citta ssesaḥ upakkilesaḥ  yaḥ saddataṇhāya

Any desire, lust, delight, craving, attraction, attachment, and clinging in regard to craving for sound …🔽craving for smell …🔽craving for taste …
craving for touch …

analyzed: yaḥ dhamma taṇhāya chanda rāgaḥ citta ssesaḥ upakkileso
translated: craving for thoughts is a defilement of the mind.🔽When a monk …

original: Yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno …pe…🔽abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyesu dhammesū”ti.
analyzed: yatas kho bhikkhave bhikkhuno pe 🔽abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyesu dhammesu uti

The eighth.
Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.117
The Kilesavagga
The Elements
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Yo, bhikkhave, pathavīdhātuyā chandarāgo, cittasseso upakkileso.🔽Yo āpodhātuyā …🔽yo tejodhātuyā …
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave pathavī dhātuyā chanda rāgaḥ citta ssesaḥ upakkileso  āpodhātuyā  tejaḥ dhātuyā
translated: “Monks, any desire, lust, delight, craving, attraction, attachment, and clinging in regard to the earth element is a defilement of the mind.🔽Any desire, lust, delight, craving, attraction, attachment, and clinging in regard to the water element …🔽the fire element …
the air element …
the space element …

analyzed: yaḥ viññāṇa dhātuyā chanda rāgaḥ citta sseso upakkileso
translated: the consciousness element is a defilement of the mind.

original: Yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno imesu chasu ṭhānesu cetaso upakkileso pahīno hoti, nekkhammaninnañcassa cittaṁ hoti.
analyzed: yatas kho bhikkhave bhikkhunaḥ imesu chasu ṭhānesu cetasaḥ upakkilesaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti nekkhamma ninnam cassa cittam hoti
translated: “When a monk has abandoned the defilements of the mind in these six cases, his mind inclines to renunciation.

original: Nekkhammaparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ kammaniyaṁ khāyati, abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyesu dhammesū”ti.
analyzed: nekkhamma paribhāvitam cittam kammaniyam khāyati abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyesu dhammesu
translated: When the mind is nourished with renunciation, it becomes wieldy in regard to those qualities that must be realized by direct knowledge.”
The ninth.
Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.118
The Kilesavagga
The Aggregates
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Yo, bhikkhave, rūpasmiṁ chandarāgo, cittasseso upakkileso …pe… yo viññāṇasmiṁ chandarāgo, cittasseso upakkileso.
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave rūpasmim chanda rāgaḥ citta ssesaḥ upakkilesaḥ pe yaḥ viññāṇasmim chanda rāgaḥ citta ssesaḥ upakkilesaḥ
translated: “Monks, any desire, lust, delight, craving, attraction, attachment, and clinging in regard to form is a defilement of the mind. … Any desire, lust, delight, craving, attraction, attachment, and clinging in regard to consciousness is a defilement of the mind.

original: Yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno imesu pañcasu ṭhānesu cetaso upakkileso pahīno hoti, nekkhammaninnañcassa cittaṁ hoti.
analyzed: yatas kho bhikkhave bhikkhunaḥ imesu pañcasu ṭhānesu cetasaḥ upakkilesaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti nekkhamma ninnam cassa cittam hoti
translated: his mind tends toward seclusion, inclines toward seclusion, leans toward seclusion.

original: Nekkhammaparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ kammaniyaṁ khāyati, abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyesu dhammesū”ti.
analyzed: nekkhamma paribhāvitam cittam kammaniyam khāyati abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyesu dhammesu
translated: Since his mind tends toward seclusion, inclines toward seclusion, leans toward seclusion, it is rightly directed for the realization of those states that are its superior, for the destruction of suffering.”
The tenth.

original: Tassuddānaṁ🔽Cakkhu rūpañca viññāṇaṁ,🔽phasso ca vedanāya ca;
analyzed: tassa uddāna  cakkhu rūpañca viññāṇa  phasso ca vedanāya ca
translated: The first chapter on defilements is finished.🔽The summary:🔽Eye, visible object, and consciousness,🔽Contact, and also feeling and perception;
Intention, craving, and element,
These ten are with the aggregates.
